list_definition.definition: the amount held by a spoon

list_ex_of_english: As he put a spoonful of soup in his mouth he yelled ' ahh-ahm ', looking directly at the resident.
The difference last year was only a few spoonfuls of tea per week as compared with those wonderful days before the war.
Take with that the yolk of an egg and a spoonful of pot sugar or powdered sugar.
He gives a spoonful of the sherry every day to his dog"—he named a very famous racing dog—"and it has never lost a race since.
For him to talk in that way is on a par with chiding us for adding a spoonful of water to an already over-full swimming bath.
They consumed two little spoonfuls of tuna, a sip of milk and a biscuit every 48 hours and a morsel of peach.
It is like giving a child the reward of a spoonful of jam when he is taking some disagreeable medicine.
I am told that it was the one provided by the captain's wife, and that when it was shared out it amounted to just one spoonful per man.
